metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3736 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
BIND 9 resolver can crash when stale cache and stale answers are enabled,option `stale-answer-client-timeout` is set to a positive integer, and theresolver receives an RRSIG query. This issue affects BIND 9 versions9.16.12 through 9.16.36, 9.18.0 through 9.18.10, 9.19.0 through 9.19.8, and9.16.12-S1 through 9.16.36-S1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3736` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
bind9-host - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
bind9utils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
dnsutils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libbind9-160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libdns-export1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libdns1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libirs-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libirs160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libisc-export169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libisc169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libisccc-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libisccc160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libisccfg-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libisccfg160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
liblwres160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bind9 package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18').
